column4: hello. with nautilus it is possible to restore trashed files ? (the trash is not empty)
first, open the trash folder, then just drag the files to restore to the destop
well, but doing so the file is not in the original folder. it is not possible to restore the file to the original folder from trash using nautilus?
open the trash and open the other folder. Then drag the file from the trash to the other filder
but if i have several files that was deleted from several folders, i would like that they go directly to the respective folders. have i to do it manually ?
i mean, have i to find from which folder they come and drag them back to it ?

in ~/.local/share/Trash there are two folders, one of them contains a info file where there are the original position of the file. do you know if nautilus is able to use that info to restore files or not? and if yes, how?
ok. thank you. so for the moment it is not possible. thx for the information.
but only in intrepid. So no, you'll have that functionality in the next ubuntu version.
you'll be able to do that with the next ubuntu version!
